intro: Parosela greenmaniana, commonly known as the greenmaniana parosela, is a flowering plant native to the island of St. Vincent in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
